comments.content: Based on Franklin Gothic for sure. Don't know the name of the font, though. Chesh probably does.
I know I've seen it, but I'm having trouble finding it. Gimme a minnit, as the Waffle sez.
I have seen it in McDonald's Promotions and on the X-Files CCG. Now this. Just don't know what it is or where to get it. Any help is much appreciated.

Bless your heart, Ignacio, for putting me out of my misery -- this has been bugging me all day. I guess it's been a long time since I actually saw Frankie; I must have even had it at one time, since it looked so familiar, but I don't have it anymore. Nice job!
You are welcome and thanks Chesh, ha sido un placer.
yeah, it's time for us to hear that type-rock-drumming ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108092914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Releasing a song for that famous Belgian holiday, "Doce de abril"?

Ah, I'm sorry I missed out on that one. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108092914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) But I got   
a solid rehearsal with kick-a$$ rock'n'roll instead,   
so you won't hear me complain.

Monday ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108092914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) There's at least one Typophile who knows why.   
Extra points for who can guess who and why! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108092914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)

... but you can have it too of course! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108092914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) It'll be up   
for download for 36 hours.
